resources.string: Dung Beetle Quiz
What do you know about dung beetles?
This is a quiz about dung beetles.
What part of the world are there no dung beetles?
Dung beetles belong to three basic groups. What are they?
Check all that are correct
builders
tunnelers
rollers
dwellers
poopers
True or False: Dung Beetles only eat dung from herbivores?
True
False
Why do dung beetles eat poop?
Your Answer
Young dung beetles (larvae) and adult dung beetles eat different parts of the dung. Who eats what?
Adults eat the solid matter. Larave drink the juice.
Larave eat the solid matter. Adults drink the juice.
What do roller type dung beetles do with their ball?
Roll it into candles to read by.
Roll it away to eat it later.
Roll it into a snake shape to scare their friends.
Roll it away to lay eggs in it.
Roll it away to play marbles with it.
North America
Australia
Europe
Antarctica
Dung beetles are found worldwide, on every continent except Antarctica.
Dung beetles belong to three basic groups: rollers, tunnelers, and dwellers
Some will seek dung from omnivores, or animals that eat plants as well as meat.
The undigested bits of food that pass out of an animal in its dung provides food for dung beetles.
Dung beetle larvae eat the solid dung while adult dung beetles stick to liquids.
Rollers roll their ball away to either munch on it later or to use as a place to lay their eggs.
Score
